intro: Pavonia leucantha, commonly known as the white wood rose, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving them a velvety texture. Pavonia leucantha is often found in open woods, thickets, and along stream banks, thriving in partial to full sunlight.
